result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Aveontae M Marshall

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Aveontae M Marshall in court.  Attorney Connor Romenesko in court for Aveontae M Marshall.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
Case set for Status Conference. Case tagging along with 20CM2463. Court adjourned this case, Branch 30.

Defendant Aveontae M Marshall in court.  Attorney Connor Romenesko in court for Aveontae M Marshall.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Case in court with 20CM2463. Case adjourned for status conference, Branch 30.
Status conference scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Aveontae M Marshall in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for a Sscheduling Conference. Discussion held. Defendant has a pending matter  (22CM929) before the court, which has been adjourned. This case to follow. Case remains calendared in Branch 30.  Status conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Aveontae M Marshall in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Aveontae M Marshall appeared by video means. 
Case in court for pre-trial conference. Defense advises the Court they have discovery but are awaiting an offer and request and adjournment. Court orders matter adjourned. 
Case remains calendared in branch 30.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON (5-04-2022). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Aveontae M Marshall in court.  Anthony White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible.  
The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 30.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/02/2022@02:30pm
